title: How to Get over a Fear of Giant Swings

steps.headline: Practice doing tap swings high on a pit bar.
steps.description:
Here are some quick drills:
Try to hit a foam cube from the foam pit hanging in the air. Ask your coach or a friend to hold a mat in the air, and try to kick it. Try to do a timer, or a fly away into the pit.

steps.headline: Go to a bar with very soft mats under it, and practice high tap swings there.
Practice your kip/ pullover cast to handstand.
steps.description: If you are more advanced, try a kip, and if you are still starting out, practice a pullover.

steps.headline: Go to a tied bar, or a pit bar with your coach.
steps.description:
Ask her/him to spot you over from a high giant swing, keep thinking of it as really big swings. Here are some tips:
Have straight legs and pointed toes. Swing like you were swinging before. Cover your ears. Don't pike. Look at the bar. Stay open, don't be afraid to fall from a handstand.

steps.headline: Ask your coach to lightly spot, and eventually try it on your own on a tied bar, or the pit bar.
Go back to the tied bar, or pit bar, and try it from a kip/pullover, cast to handstand.
steps.description: Don't forget a spot! (It should be your coach or a high level gymnast.)

steps.headline: If you haven't already, switch to a non tied bar.
Ask your spot to spot lighter, and soon, you should try it on your own.
steps.description:
Here are some more tips:
Lean backwards in the handstand, so you can do your backward giant swing. Don't forget straight legs, and pointed toes! Fall like it's from a normal tap swing.

steps.headline: Go to the uneven bars (girls), or the high bar (boys).
steps.description: Get your coach to spot you. This time it should just be a good coach. Ask her/him to spot you from a cast to handstand.

steps.headline: Ask your coach to spot lighter and lighter.
steps.description: Before you know it, you'll attempt it, and get it on your own!

text:
Practice doing tap swings high on a pit bar. Here are some quick drills:
Try to hit a foam cube from the foam pit hanging in the air. Ask your coach or a friend to hold a mat in the air, and try to kick it. Try to do a timer, or a fly away into the pit. Go to a bar with very soft mats under it, and practice high tap swings there.  Practice your kip/ pullover cast to handstand. If you are more advanced, try a kip, and if you are still starting out, practice a pullover. Go to a tied bar, or a pit bar with your coach. Ask her/him to spot you over from a high giant swing, keep thinking of it as really big swings. Here are some tips:
Have straight legs and pointed toes. Swing like you were swinging before. Cover your ears. Don't pike. Look at the bar. Stay open, don't be afraid to fall from a handstand. Ask your coach to lightly spot, and eventually try it on your own on a tied bar, or the pit bar.  Go back to the tied bar, or pit bar, and try it from a kip/pullover, cast to handstand. Don't forget a spot! (It should be your coach or a high level gymnast.) If you haven't already, switch to a non tied bar. (Use a normal bar, no straps.) Ask your spot to spot lighter, and soon, you should try it on your own. Here are some more tips:
Lean backwards in the handstand, so you can do your backward giant swing. Don't forget straight legs, and pointed toes! Fall like it's from a normal tap swing. Go to the uneven bars (girls), or the high bar (boys). Get your coach to spot you. This time it should just be a good coach. Ask her/him to spot you from a cast to handstand. Ask your coach to spot lighter and lighter. Before you know it, you'll attempt it, and get it on your own!
